HOME.PLATFORM_DESC: The global online gaming platform for all Japanese learning enthusiasts.
HOME.CHALLENGE: Challenge yourself with Kanji-based games, improve your Japanese, and have fun with the community!

HOME.JOIN: Join the arena and may the best win!

HOME.RANKINGS_DESC: Compare your scores with other players and climb the rankings.

ABOUT.TITLE: About
ABOUT.SUBTITLE: Discover the person behind Kanji-Arena.
ABOUT.INTRO: Hello! My name is Yonni. I am a web developer and Japanese learner based in Pornic, France.
ABOUT.PASSION: I created Kanji-Arena to bring together my two passions: software development and learning Japanese. What you see here is an initial version of the project, mainly designed for recruiters â€” a concrete demonstration of what I can build with
ABOUT.BETA: The site is currently in beta, which means there may still be some bugs. The REST API is hosted on render.com and the database uses MongoDB Atlas.
ABOUT.SUPPORT: If you like the project, the best way to support me is to share it with other Japanese enthusiasts!
ABOUT.MULTILINGUAL: Regarding Kanji-Arena, my goal is to make it known to as many people as possible. I will soon work to make it multilingual, with French and English as the first languages.
ABOUT.FLAGS: I also plan to add player flags
ABOUT.PLANS: to the leaderboards, launch a global ranking, and eventually organize a real Kanji World Championship... nothing less!

IDEAS.MIX_GAME_DESC: This game combines the Classic and Reverse modes. The goal is to randomly guess a kanji from a given meaning, or guess the meaning of a displayed kanji.
IDEAS.MAX_GAME_DESC: In this mode, each mistake is fatal! You must guess the meaning of a kanji in less than 5 seconds. The objective is to chain as many correct answers as possible for the longest flawless streak.
IDEAS.PUBLIC_PROFILE_DESC: Create a public profile allowing all players to view each memberâ€™s scores and times. A great way to boost competition and see whoâ€™s at the top!
IDEAS.WEEKLY_CHALLENGES_DESC: Add weekly challenges where players can participate in special competitions to earn exclusive rewards, such as badges or bonus points. These challenges could include specific objectives, like answering a certain number of kanji correctly within a time limit.
